DOC.detailed_description: Twin pregnancies 50 % incidence preterm delivery ( 37 week gestation ) , increase perinatal mortality neonatal morbidity . No therapy proven effective prevent preterm birth twin . When cervical dilation identify 24 week singleton pregnancy , risk preterm birth 90 % -100 % ; base small series case , approximately 50 % twin gestation cervical dilation deliver prior viability ( 24 week ) risk preterm birth prior 34 37 week 85 % 100 % . Cervical dilation bad prognostic factor preterm birth . There small number case report cervical cerclage twin pregnancy dilate cervix suggest similar outcome singleton pregnancy . The investigator ' objective determine physical exam indicate cerclage reduces incidence spontaneous preterm birth < 34 week improve perinatal outcome asymptomatic woman twin gestation dilate cervix ( 1 5 cm ) 16 23 6/7 week gestation .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Pregnant woman older 18 year age 2 . Diamniotic twin pregnancy 3 . Cervical dilation 1 5 cm and/or visible membrane pelvic exam speculum exam 1623 6/7 week gestation 1 . Singleton pregnancy high order twin multiple gestation 2 . Cervical dilation 5 cm 3 . Amniotic membrane prolapse beyond external os vagina , unable visualize cervical tissue 4 . More 24 week gestation 5 . Multifetal reduction 14 week 6 . Monoamniotic twin 7 . Twintwin transfusion syndrome 8 . Ruptured amniotic membrane time diagnosis dilate cervix 9 . Major fetal structural anomaly 10 . Fetal chromosomal abnormality 11 . Cerclage already place indication 12 . Active vaginal bleeding 13 . Suspicion clinical biochemical chorioamnionitis 14 .
